content.question: The influence of older northern European artistic traditions on the work shown demonstrates that

choices.label: there was a steady exchange of ideas between Christians in the British Isles and mainland Europe during the early Middle Ages
a well-developed bookmaking tradition existed in the British Isles even before Christian missionaries arrived there
the patrons who commissioned such works wanted to uphold their old pagan beliefs even after they converted to Christianity
missionaries in the British Isles embraced the local artistic style in their efforts to spread Christianity to new converts

content.answer: missionaries in the British Isles embraced the local artistic style in their efforts to spread Christianity to new converts

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Explain the meaning or significance of continuity and/or change between works of art (or groups of related works of art) within a related artistic tradition, style, or practice.
